title.rendered: Movies Filmed in Thailand Streaming on Netflix Right Now

content.rendered:
Movies Filmed in Thailand Streaming on Netflix Right Now

Thailand’s vibrant landscapes, rich culture, and exotic locations have captivated filmmakers from around the world. With its stunning beaches, bustling cities, and lush jungles, Thailand serves as the perfect backdrop for numerous movie productions. If you’re a cinephile with a fondness for Thai scenery, you’re in luck! In this article, we’ll explore a selection of movies filmed in Thailand that are currently available to stream on Netflix. So grab your popcorn, sit back, and embark on a cinematic journey through the Land of Smiles.

Table of Contents

1. The Beach (2000)

Based on the popular novel by Alex Garland, “The Beach” showcases the natural beauty of Thailand. Starring Leonardo DiCaprio, the film takes place on the picturesque island of Ko Phi Phi Leh. Its stunning beaches, clear turquoise waters, and lush greenery create an idyllic setting for the movie’s adventure-filled storyline. Directed by Danny Boyle, “The Beach” is a must-watch for those seeking both a thrilling narrative and captivating Thai scenery.

2. Only God Forgives (2013)

Directed by Nicolas Winding Refn, “Only God Forgives” is a dark and visually striking thriller that immerses viewers in the gritty underbelly of Bangkok. Filmed entirely in the Thai capital, the movie features breathtaking nightscapes, neon-lit streets, and the city’s hidden corners. Starring Ryan Gosling, the film explores themes of vengeance and redemption while simultaneously showcasing the contrast between Bangkok’s chaotic urban landscape and its spiritual traditions.

3. The Hangover Part II (2011)

If you’re in the mood for a hilarious comedy, “The Hangover Part II” will tickle your funny bone while offering a glimpse of Thailand. This raucous sequel takes the characters from Las Vegas to Bangkok, providing a whirlwind adventure filled with outrageous situations and unforgettable moments. While the film primarily focuses on the comedic narrative, it also captures the energy and vibrancy of Thailand’s capital city, with scenes set in various iconic locations, including the vibrant street markets and the breathtaking Chao Phraya River.

4. Extraction (2020)

“Extraction” combines heart-pounding action and stunning cinematography as it takes audiences on a thrilling journey through Thailand and other international locations. Starring Chris Hemsworth, the film tells the story of a black-market mercenary tasked with rescuing the kidnapped son of an international crime lord. Thailand’s bustling streets, vibrant markets, and dense urban areas provide a dynamic backdrop for the adrenaline-fueled chase sequences and intense fight scenes. From the crowded streets of Bangkok to the picturesque landscapes of Ratchaburi province, “Extraction” offers a gripping action experience set against the captivating beauty of Thailand.

Conclusion

Thailand’s enchanting landscapes have been a popular choice for filmmakers, attracting both local and international productions. These movies filmed in Thailand and currently available on Netflix allow viewers to experience the beauty and cultural richness of the country from the comfort of their own homes. Whether you’re seeking a thrilling adventure, a thought-provoking drama, or a laugh-out-loud comedy, these films offer a diverse range of genres and provide a cinematic journey through the captivating landscapes of Thailand. So grab your remote, search for these movies on Netflix, and let yourself be transported to the Land of Smiles.

Disclaimer: The availability of movies on Netflix may vary depending on your location and the platform’s content licensing agreements. Please check Netflix for the most up-to-date information on the availability of these movies in your region.
